headline: Equifax National Market Pulse Data Shows U.S. Consumer Debt Inching Past $18 Trillion as Delinquencies Stabilize
summary: Equifax® (NYSE: EFX) has released its Market Pulse Third Quarter U.S. Consumer Credit Trends, which includes U.S. national consumer credit data and trends through September 2025 sourced from Equifax data. According to Equifax, delinquency on total U.S. consumer debt inched up to 1.562% in September, a slight increase from 1.517% at end of the second quarter in June 2025. Total consumer debt reached $18.03 trillion in September, up from $17.91 trillion in August and $17.94 trillion in July.
